title: The Fake Meeting Invite
setting: Summit Solutions, conference room, Tuesday 2 PM
premise: Someone created a fake calendar invite titled 'Mandatory All-Hands: Layoff Discussion' for 2 PM Tuesday, causing a company-wide panic. The invite was created from an unattended computer in the open workspace at 12:35 PM.

suspects.name: Nora Fischer
suspects.motive: Frustrated that management ignores her warnings about employee morale
suspects.alibi: I was in a closed-door meeting with the VP of Operations from 12:00 to 1:30 PM. His assistant booked it last week and it's on both our calendars.

suspects.name: Trent Nakamura
suspects.motive: Angry about mandatory return-to-office policy and wanted to cause chaos
suspects.alibi: I was working from home Tuesday. I logged into the VPN at 8 AM and was online all day. My commit history shows code pushes at 12:15, 12:40, and 1:10 PM.

suspects.name: Bianca Torres
suspects.motive: Wanted to sabotage the 3 PM client presentation her rival was leading
suspects.alibi: I was at lunch at the Thai place on Fifth Street with two clients from 12:00 to 1:15 PM. We split the bill and I have the credit card charge to prove it.

suspects.name: Lucas Webb
suspects.motive: Recently received a poor performance review and resents management
suspects.alibi: I was in the open workspace area all morning working on campaign reports. At noon I walked to the deli on Third Street for a sandwich and got back around 12:50.

clues.title: Workspace Occupancy
clues.content: A colleague says the open workspace was nearly empty during lunch. She left at 12:10 PM and when she returned at 1 PM only Lucas was at his desk.

clues.title: Network Login Records
clues.content: IT pulled the login timestamps for the workstation used to create the invite. Someone logged in with guest credentials at 12:30 PM and logged out at 12:38 PM.

clues.title: Deli Timestamp
clues.content: The deli on Third Street is a fifteen-minute walk each way. Lucas's debit card was charged there at 12:03 PM, meaning he would have been back at the office well before 12:30 -- not at 12:50 as he claimed.

hints.text: Think carefully about when each suspect could have been near the open workspace around 12:30 PM.
Does the timing of a certain lunch trip actually match up with when that person claims they returned to the office?
